Title: GFDC resumes football coaching after a gap of two years
Interest: gfdc, football, goa, brahmanand shankwalkar, Sports, grassrootfootball
Narrative:
For over two years there was no sporting activity in India due to
the nationwide lockdown, but Goa’s first Arjuna Award winner, Brahmanand Shankwalkar can’t wait to lead by example once again. Earlier this month, Goa Football Development Council (GFDC) kicked off 24 of its training centres after a gap of two long years.
It is definitely not an easy task to bring the kids back on the field after a very long gap. By the first week of August they are aiming to restart all the other centres as well. 
Brahmanand took charge of the office in August 2020. He is in the know-how of things as he has been a member of the council committee since inception and
his long association will now prove useful as he streamlines the functioning of GFDC. 
One can recall that GFDC was conceptualised by the former Chief Minister of Goa, late Manohar Parrikar in 2012 when he had declared football as the official state sport.
